content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a round-trip flight from Buenos Aires to Beijing, leaving on May 28, 2026, and returning on June 3, 2026, check out one of the options and tell me if the airline for my return flight is the same as my departure flight.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/travel/flights/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to change the departure city from "Toronto" to "Buenos Aires". The relevant textbox for this is labeled [13]. 
Action: Type [13]; Buenos Aires
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.10
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "From" city is now set to Buenos Aires. I now need to enter "Beijing" for the "Where to?" (destination) textbox, which is labeled [14].
Action: Type [14]; Beijing
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The destination is now set to Beijing. The next step is to set the "Departure" date, which should be May 28, 2026. The relevant field is labeled [16].
Action: Click [16]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.20
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently displaying September and October of the previous year. My target dates are May and June 2026, so I need to keep navigating forward in the calendar.
Action: Click [74]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing October and November. I need to keep moving forward in the calendar to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.23
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current calendar view is showing November and December. To reach May 2026, I need to keep moving forward in the calendar.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current calendar view is showing December and January 2026. I need to continue moving forward in the calendar to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [76]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.27
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently displaying January and February 2026. I need to continue navigating forward to reach May 2026 for the correct departure date.
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.28
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows February and March 2026, but I need to reach May 2026. I need to keep moving forward.
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.30
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar view is now showing March and April 2026. I need to move forward again to reach May 2026 for the correct travel dates.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.32
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar shows May 2026. I need to select May 28, 2026 as the departure date, which corresponds to element [69].
Action: Click [69]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.40
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure date is set (May 27), but I need May 28. I now need to select the return date (June 3, 2026), but the calendar currently displays only up to May 2026. I should scroll to the next month to set the correct return date.
Action: Click [78]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The June 2026 calendar is now visible, and the correct return date is June 3, 2026 which corresponds to element [49]. I should now select this date.
Action: Click [49]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.60

Thought: Both the departure (May 28) and return (June 3) dates are now selected. I need to confirm these selections to proceed to flight options. The "Done" button is labeled [81].
Action: Click [81]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.70

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[2]: <button> "Travel";	[3]: <button> "Explore";	[4]: <button> "Flights";	[5]: <button> "Hotels";	[6]: <button> "Vacation rentals";	[7]: <button> "Change appearance";	[9]: "Sign in";	[11]: <button> "1", "1 passenger";	[13]: <input> "Where from?";	[14]: <button> "Swap origin and destination.";	[15]: <input> "Where to?";	[16]: <input> "Departure";	[17]: <button> "";	[18]: <button> "";	[19]: <input> "Return";	[20]: <button> "";	[21]: <button> "";	[22]: <button> "Search";	[23]: <button> "Explore deals";

content:
Thought: All required information (origin, destination, dates) is filled in. The next step is to search for available flight options by clicking the "Search" button labeled [22].
Action: Click [22]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.80

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[2]: <button> "Travel";	[3]: <button> "Explore";	[4]: <button> "Flights";	[5]: <button> "Hotels";	[6]: <button> "Vacation rentals";	[7]: <button> "Change appearance";	[9]: "Sign in";	[11]: <button> "1", "1 passenger, change number of passengers.";	[13]: <input> "Where from?";	[14]: <button> "Swap origin and destination.";	[15]: <input> "Where to?";	[16]: <input> "Departure";	[17]: <button> "";	[18]: <button> "";	[19]: <input> "Return";	[20]: <button> "";	[21]: <button> "";	[22]: <button> "All filters";	[23]: <button> "Stops", "Stops, Not selected";	[24]: <button> "Airlines", "Airlines, Not selected";	[25]: <button> "Bags", "Bags, Not selected";	[26]: <button> "Price", "Price, Not selected";	[27]: <button> "Times", "Times, Not selected";	[28]: <button> "Emissions", "Emissions, Not selected";	[29]: <button> "Language​English (United States)";	[30]: <button> "Location​Canada";	[31]: <button> "Currency​CAD";	[32]: "About", "About Google Travel";	[33]: "Privacy";	[34]: "Terms";	[35]: "Join user studies";	[36]: "Feedback";	[37]: "Help Center";	[38]: "Learn more", "Learn more about currencies";

content:
Thought: The flight search was submitted, but the results are not currently visible. I need to scroll down the page to see the available flight options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.85
